intro: Sida schrankii, commonly known as the Schrank's mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, heart-shaped leaves, and showy pink or purple flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Sida schrankii is also valued for its traditional medicinal uses in some regions.
